alert.note: Alert for Somerset (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 10:27PM EST until January 10 at 2:30PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Maryland, including the following counties, Somerset, Wicomico and Worcester. * WHEN...Until 430 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1027 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Salisbury, Ocean City, Fruitland, Salisbury University, Berlin, Delmar, Snow Hill, Hebron, Newark, Parsonsburg, Ocean Pines, Cape Isle Of Wight, Pittsville, Willards, Powellville, Whiton, Whaleyville, Salisbury-Wicomico, Cedartown and Longridge. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
